text: Saint David (c. 512 - 587) is the patron saint of Wales. He was a Welsh bishop in the 6th century. He is usually represented standing on a little hill, with a dove on his shoulder. He is commemorated on 1 March. The earliest mention of St. David is found in a tenth-century manuscript of the "Annales Cambriae", which assigns his death to A.D. 601. ==Related pages== *Saint David's Day ==References== * Catholic Online Category:512 births Category:587 deaths Category:British priests Category:Christian saints Category:Bishops Category:Welsh Christians
title: Saint David
